data.title: Pipeline icon from UNC file
data.body: Move `ExtractAssociatedIcon(...)` to `Util` and try to extract icon for UNC file paths.

data.title: MonoGame crashes on Windows Phone 8.1 (Emulator and level 9_3 devices)
data.body:
MonoGame crashes in the Windows Phone 8.1 Emulator (Emulator 8.1 U1 WVGA 4 inch 512MB) and potentially all feature level 9_3 devices.

The app exits with:
SharpDX.SharpDXException: HRESULT: [0x887A0005], Module: [SharpDX.DXGI], ApiCode: [DXGI_ERROR_DEVICE_REMOVED/DeviceRemoved], Message: The GPU device instance has been suspended. Use GetDeviceRemovedReason to determine the appropriate action.

I have tracked the problem down to the following line:
https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/ca6e7edc007b0a73dc36810b4ef4b4e851ec44f1/MonoGame.Framework/Graphics/TextureCollection.DirectX.cs#L82
MonoGame is trying to clear the vertex texture slot. However, feature level 9_3 (or lower) does not support vertex textures. This call results in: "D3D11: Removing Device."

Suggested solution:
Disable vertex textures if feature level <= 9_3 (Reach profile).
Enable vertex textures only if feature level >= 10_0 (HiDef profile).

data.title: Implement GetParameterB​ySemantic
data.body: To implement `EffectParameterCollection.GetParameterB​ySemantic()` we need to first extend the MGFX parser to parse out semantics in parameter definitions.  We can then include the semantic in the compiled .mgfx file and used from the `EffectParameterCollection` and `EffectParameter` types.

data.title: [WIP] Base implementation of NVorbis for Linux and WinGL
data.body:
Addressing #3625

I am not changing anything for Mac because I don't have a Mac and I really don't want to break anything.

I have tested it on Linux, and I am gonna use files that teamcity builds to test it on Windows.

OggStream.cs is modified version of http://theinstructionlimit.com/ogg-streaming-using-opentk-and-nvorbis, just added needed stuff like on finish action and position/length.

data.title: Suggestion : Implement SkinnedModel to MonoGame core ?
data.body: I think its good idea - many 3d games and engines uses skinned models today. XNA has it but as separate example - my suggestion is to include it to the MonoGame core. With AnimationPlayer, Keyframe, SkinningModelProcessor(possible SkinnedModel) as support to already existed skinned effect(and adding Skinned Effect to templates of pipeline is not a bad idea too). The current system force user to write it manually(which is not fast and irritates) or use other libraries(which is not good for such a base thing).

data.body:
Trying to compile a font with it on throws:

```
/home/harry/Documents/newfont.spritefont
Building Font /usr/share/fonts/truetype/msttcorefonts/Arial.ttf
Using DXT Compression
System.EntryPointNotFoundException: nvttSetOutputOptionsOutputHandler

  at Nvidia.TextureTools.OutputOptions.SetOutputHandler (Nvidia.TextureTools.ImageDelegate beginImage, Nvidia.TextureTools.WriteDataDelegate writeImage) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.GraphicsUtil.CompressDxt (GraphicsProfile profile, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.TextureContent content, Boolean generateMipmaps, Boolean premultipliedAlpha, Boolean sharpAlpha) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.FontDescriptionProcessor.Process (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.FontDescription input, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessorContext context) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
```

Trying to compile a texture with it:

```
/home/harry/Documents/0.png
Using DXT Compression
Could not compress texture Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.PipelineException: DXT Compressed textures width and height must be powers of two in GraphicsProfile.Reach.
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.GraphicsUtil.CompressDxt (GraphicsProfile profile, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.TextureContent content, Boolean generateMipmaps, Boolean premultipliedAlpha, Boolean sharpAlpha) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.GraphicsUtil.CompressTexture (GraphicsProfile profile, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.TextureContent content, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessorContext context, Boolean generateMipmaps, Boolean premultipliedAlpha, Boolean sharpAlpha) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.TextureProcessor.Process (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.TextureContent input, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessorContext context) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
```

and changing to GraphicsProfile HiDef gives:

```
/home/harry/Documents/0.png
Using DXT Compression
Could not find the entry point to compress the texture
```

data.title: Linux game icon not changeable
data.body:
Anyway, Icon.ExtractAssociatedIcon is not implemented in mono:
https://github.com/mono/mono/blob/master/mcs/class/System.Drawing/System.Drawing/Icon.cs#L303
and we use that to setup the icon for WinGL and Linux:
https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Desktop/OpenTKGameWindow.cs#L337

One possible solution for this would be to add Icon property to Game.cs.

data.title: GamePad throws Exception in Windows 10 UAP projects on phones
data.body:
Using the new Windows 10 UAP templates, there an exception is thrown when using the GamePad API.

This happens only when running the app on a Windows 10 Phone (emulator in this case), not when running on a desktop PC.

``` C#
bool isBackButtonPressed = GamePad.GetState(PlayerIndex.One).Buttons.Back == ButtonState.Pressed;
-----------
{System.DllNotFoundException: Unable to load DLL 'xinput1_4.dll': The specified module could not be found. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x8007007E)
   at SharpDX.XInput.XInput.XInputGetState_(Int32 arg0, Void* arg1)
   at SharpDX.XInput.XInput.XInputGetState(Int32 dwUserIndex, State& stateRef)
   at SharpDX.XInput.XInput14.XInputGetState(Int32 dwUserIndex, State& stateRef)
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Input.GamePad.PlatformGetState(Int32 index, GamePadDeadZone deadZoneMode)
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Input.GamePad.GetState(PlayerIndex playerIndex, GamePadDeadZone deadZoneMode)
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Input.GamePad.GetState(PlayerIndex playerIndex)
   at Salad.SaladGame.Update(GameTime gameTime)
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.DoUpdate(GameTime gameTime)
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.Tick()
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.UAPGameWindow.Tick()
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.UAPGamePlatform.<>c.<StartRunLoop>b__10_0(Object o, Object a)}``
```

data.title: [MGCB][Feature request?] Default action for extension
data.body:
Hi,

I'm aware that I can create a Custom Processor in the pipeline and assign a default action for file extensions with the attribute ContentImporter.

However, is it possible to set the build action to "copy" instead of "build" for a defined set of extensions? 

In example, I have some .map files which I have to constantly add to my projects. Each time I add it, I have to change the build action to "copy". In the future I may write an importer but right now I'd prefer just a copy to get my current code work without major modifications.

data.title: [MGCB]Adding a reference and then saving is not possible
data.body:
Hi,

just add a reference to a MGCB project. Then, using File -> Save is grayed. (probably not "dirtying" the project)

data.title: [Win Pipeline] Menu/context menu improvements
data.body:
Stuff done:
- Context Menu: "Open File Location" should only be visible when one item is selected
- Context Menu: "Add Menu" should only be visible if one item is selected and it's not a file
- Context Menu: "Open File" should only be visible if one item is selected and it's a file
- Context Menu: "Rename" should be visible only if one item is selected
- Menu: "Add" menu should only be enabled if one or less items are selected
- Menu: "Delete" menu should only be enabled if one or more items are selected
- Menu: "Rename" menu should only be enabled if exactly one item is selected

data.title: SoundEffect Play Speed differs depending on audiofile's sample rate
data.body:
I noticed when working on a MonoGame project using the MonoGame 3.3 Stable build that the SoundEffectInstance would play audio at a slower speed on one of my wav files.

I discovered that if the WAV file has a sample rate of 96kHz, it will play twice as slow as the same WAV file running at 44.1kHz.

These are the audio files I tested with:
[44.1kHz WAV file](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/30381754/Kpow-Scroll.wav)
[96kHz WAV file](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/30381754/Kpow-Scroll96k.wav)

I loaded them in using the MonoGame Pipeline Tool and then Loaded them into SoundEffect objects. When I played both audio files inside a MonoGame Desktop build, the 96kHz one was noticeably slower, even with a lower tempo than the 44.1kHz one.

data.title: [Gtk Pipeline] Bunch of Improvements
data.body:
I've been reading Gtk documentation for the entire day... and I've learned a lot:
- Gdk.Color, Gtk.ColorSelection and Gtk.ColorSelectionDialog are all deprecated starting from gtk 3.4 (currently gtk is at version 3.16, every six months minor version increases by 2), the replacement for them were Gdk.Argb(existed since 3.0), Gtk.ColorChooser and Gtk.ColorChooserDialog (both exist since 3.4), and since the last 2 didn't exist in gtk-sharp I added a wrapper for them
- Fixed some annoying warnings that would appear in the Application Output about not calling the Dialog with the specified parent window
- Replaced both ColorPickerDialog and YesNoCancel dialog with Gtk native implementation of them
- Removed MainMenu.xib, useless file left from xwt
- Moved IgeMacIntegration to Gtk folder
- Added a Global file which just gives some global info about Gtk Version and running Desktop Environment
